title._content: [Portrait of Uffe Bode, Doc Pomus, Sol (Solomon) Yaged, John (O.) Levy, and Rex William Stewart, Pied Piper, New York, N.Y., ca. Sept. 1947] (LOC)

description._content: Gottlieb, William P., 1917-, photographer. [Portrait of Uffe Bode, Doc Pomus, Sol (Solomon) Yaged, John (O.) Levy, and Rex William Stewart, Pied Piper, New York, N.Y., ca. Sept. 1947] 1 negative : b&w ; 2 1/4 x 2 1/4 in. Caption from Down Beat: One of the weekly jam sessions sponsored in the Village by Timmie Rosenkrantz produced these photos, by Got. Second shot shows Rex Stewart, trumpet; Sol Yaged, clarinet; Uffe Bode, drummer; Doc Pomus, singer. One modern and several standard groups were used. Notes: Gottlieb Collection Assignment No. 296 Reference print available in Music Division, Library of Congress. Purchase William P. Gottlieb Forms part of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (Library of Congress). In: "All kinds of musical allegiances gather under the Dane's banner," Down Beat, v. 14, no. 19 (Sept. 10, 1947), p. 3. Subjects: Bode, Uffe Pomus, Doc Yaged, Sol (Solomon) Levy, John (O.) Stewart, Rex William, 1907-1967 Jazz musicians--1940-1950. Jazz singers--1940-1950. Pied Piper Format: Portrait photographs--1940-1950. Group portraits--1940-1950. Film negatives--1940-1950. Rights Info: Mr. Gottlieb has dedicated these works to the public domain, but rights of privacy and publicity may apply. lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-copyrig... Repository: (negative) Library of Congress, Prints & Photographs Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print (reference print) Library of Congress, Music Division, Washington D.C. 20540 USA, loc.gov/rr/perform/ Part Of: William P. Gottlieb Collection (DLC) 99-401005 General information about the Gottlieb Collection is available at lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/ihas/html/gottlieb/gottlieb-home.html Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/gottlieb.07121 Call Number: LC-GLB23- 0712
